name: Odd Medical Facts Quiz | Miscellaneous Health | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the chief symptom of the visual disorder known as diplopia?
questions.explanation:
double vision.

	In medical terminology the prefix di means two, thus giving you double. Ironically enough also in medical terminology bi also means two.

questions.text: What are you afraid of if you suffer from metrophobia?
questions.explanation:
poetry.

	I guess Jack and Jill would neither be cute nor funny!

questions.text: Which two books of the Bible were written by a physician?
questions.explanation:
Luke and Acts.

	Written by St. Luke who of course was a physician.

questions.text: Which of these scientists made a major contribution to the development of the thermometer?
questions.explanation:
Galileo.

	One of the many things he invented that has lasted over the ages.

questions.text: When was the first book on birth control published in the U.S.?
questions.explanation:
1830.

	The book Moral Physiology was written by social reformer Robert Dale Owen.

questions.text: Where in an adult human body would you find the muscles that contract the most frequently over the course of a typical day?
questions.explanation:
In the eyes.

	The small muscles that constantly adjust eye position move, on average, three to four times per second in patterns called saccades. For comparison, the human heart beats only one to one and a half times per second (60 to 90 per minute) at rest and rarely faster than three beats per second (180 per minute) even at maximum exertion.

questions.text: How many quarts of blood does the average adult heart pump through its chambers during an hour of just sitting quietly?
questions.explanation:
300.

	During exercise this can increase as much as 1200 quarts or 300 gallons an hour.

questions.text: What was the name of the world's first human test-tube baby?
questions.explanation:
Louise.

	She was Louise Brown, and she was born in England in 1978.

questions.text: Who had the first medicine balls made for his patients?
questions.explanation:
Hippocrates.

	He had the balls sewn out of animal skins and stuffed with sand. He directed his patients to lob them back and forth to prevent and recover from certain injuries.

questions.text: In what country was the first known cataract surgery performed?
questions.explanation:
India.

	As close as they can figure it was performed sometime aroud the year 500 B.C.
